##Code##
def get_possible_value(encoded):
    for i, code in enumerate(codes):
        if encoded.startswith(code):
            rem = encoded[len(code):]
            return characters[i], rem
    raise ValueError("Unable to find value to decode")

def decode(encoded_value):
    output = []
    while len(encoded_value) > 0:
        decoded_char, encoded_value = get_possible_value(encoded_value)
        output.append(decoded_char)
    return ''.join(output)

characters = [" ", "z", "y", "x", "w", "v", "u", "t", "s", "r", "q", "p", "o", "n", "m", "l", "k", "j", "i", "h", "g", "f", "e", "d", "c", "b", "a"]
codes = ["11111111110001", "11111111110000", "1111111111", "1111111110", "1111111101", "1111111100", "1111111011", "1111111010", "1111111001", "1111111000", "1111110111", "1111110110", "1111110101", "1111110100", "1111110011", "1111110010", "1111110001", "1111110000", "111110", "111101", "111100", "1110", "1101", "1100", "10", "01", "00"]

encoded_value = ""

decoded_value = decode(encoded_value)

print(decoded_value)

##Output##
i love angelhack code challenge because it is fun and exciting and i dislike the word   that appears in the phrase
